title: Fix pipes and proxies
message: Fix pipes and proxies

title: Fix cloud <-> server integration
message: Fix cloud <-> server integration

title: platform/server: add some static file support
message:
platform/server: add some static file support

So that apps can supply their CSS and JS for the UI

title: Add rudimentary UI support
message:
Add rudimentary UI support

The frontend can now obtain a reference to an app, and ask it to
produce some UI, which can be a raw HTML string or a reference
to a Jade view.

For now, only the server platform supports it, because it is easy
there. Cloud needs a way to arbitrate the different running engine
instances, phone needs to emulate the web server in the webkit UI
it uses internally (or just use cloud)

title: Kill old IFTTT code
message:
Kill old IFTTT code

This code was never tested, likely buggy, and was written just
to prove that the model was not inferior to old rulepedia - which
probably was never disputed because the new model is designed
to be more powerful. And it was creating confusion in reviewers
trying to learn the system.

title: Fixes
message:
Fixes

I should have done this before pushing.

Anyway, now pipes are at least locally tested.

title: Add 'brannigan' app
message:
Add 'brannigan' app

"He's the one who zapps"

Based on a well-known online service, add an app that allows to
pull data from a channel, apply simple filters on it, then
push it out on a different channels, with simple transformations.

title: engine: introduce pipe concept
message:
engine: introduce pipe concept

Named pipes are a simple way to chain multiple apps (by the same
or different authors), allowing one app to push into the named
pipe and another app to receive data from it, seamlessly across
different tiers.

title: Fix debian package generation
message:
Fix debian package generation

(Maybe)

title: Android: add cloud integration
message:
Android: add cloud integration

This is the other side of the previous commit. It adds some
integration code to pull the cloud ID and auth token from the
cloud web page and pass them to the local engine.

title: cloud: add Android integration
message:
cloud: add Android integration

When running inside the app and the user logs in or successfully
registers, propagate the cloud ID and auth token settings to
the Android Java code (which will forward them to the node.js
thread and from there the engine will know how to connect to
the cloud and sync itself.

title: cloud: switch to MySQL
message:
cloud: switch to MySQL

Pepperjack has it already installed and configured

title: Add cloud platform
message:
Add cloud platform

Similar to the server platform, except that we run a different
engine instance for each registered user.

title: Implement proxy channels
message:
Implement proxy channels

As part of the "run anywhere" design, implement a proxy channel
system that will give an app access to all channels transparently.

title: Add a debian build system for server platform
message:
Add a debian build system for server platform

To easily deploy to Raspbian

title: Engine: introduce TierManager
message:
Engine: introduce TierManager

Which can set up a stable web socket connection between the phone
and the private server and between the phone and the cloud.

title: Refactor the engine, fill in databases, introduce apps
message:
Refactor the engine, fill in databases, introduce apps

The previous IFTTT concept was too limited, let's replace it
with the concept of "apps". Apps are simple objects with
a start() and a stop() that can be instantiated given a node.js
module on the server (or builtin) using arbitrary stored parameters.

Also introduce an "ifttt" kind of app, which implements exactly
what Rulepedia did (and tries to be compatible with it), with
all drawbacks and limitations.

title: Switch to Android Studio 1.3
message:
Switch to Android Studio 1.3

No functional changes

title: platform/android: replace eventfd with full bidirectional control channel
message:
platform/android: replace eventfd with full bidirectional control channel

In the future it will come in handy to have a full bidirectional
channel between the service Java world and the JS thread.
Implement that using Unix domain sockets (with a filesystem path
because socketpair() is ugly to use from Android) with simple
JSON based marshalling.
Two methods are supported: foo (echo a number) and stop (stop
the engine). Thanks to the latter now stopping a service is
reliable.

title: Build system fixes
message: Build system fixes

title: Finish up Android platform implementation
message:
Finish up Android platform implementation

Now tested, the engine loads fine and it runs on Android.
There is code to handle graceful engine termination, but it
doesn't work on Android, probably because node.js doesn't like
eventfd. Works fine on server, because it uses SIGINT.

title: Refactor a little bit the Android code
message:
Refactor a little bit the Android code

To be consistent with the new Sabrina in the naming

title: Rework engine and platform integration
message:
Rework engine and platform integration

Kill cordova, and move to a manual usage of jxcore to access
nodejs. Also includes a stub of ChannelFactory API that downloads
code off the net.

title: Replace android with cordova+jxcore
message:
Replace android with cordova+jxcore

jxcore is a cordova plugin that allows us to use node.js on iOS
From a few hours of Googling, it seems to be the only reasonable
way to run node.js on iOS

title: Initial commit
message:
Initial commit

Skeleton for engine, platform/android and platform/server
Includes a working HTTP server that also happens to run the engine.
